concept.title: Credit-Control-Failure-Handling (CCFH) AVP support in the NCC Gy interface

section.title: Overview
section.p: The credit-control client uses the information in CCFH AVP to handle the credit control server failure.
The NCC application supports the CCFH AVP in Credit-Control-Answer (CCA) command with the values TERMINATE(0), CONTINUE (1), RETRY_AND_TERMINATE (2), and IGNORE (3).
section.note: CCFH AVP is not applicable for IEC calls.
section.p: NCC performs the following logic based on the values set:

li.p: If the value of CCFH is configured as IGNORE in active RSV, then CCFH AVP is not returned in CCA.
If the value is NULL, then CCFH AVP is returned in CCA as TERMINATE.
